default: (a) {@item chain mail|phb} or (b) {@item leather armor|phb}, {@item longbow|phb}, and {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}
(a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Maneuver Versatility
entries: If you know any maneuvers from the fighter's Battle Master archetype, you can replace one maneuver you know with a different maneuver whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. This change reflects your physical and mental preparation for the day ahead.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace a fighting style you know with another style available to your class. This change represents a shift of focus in your martial training and practice, causing you to lose the benefits of one style and gain the benefits of another style.

classFeature.name: Second Wind
entries: You have a limited well of physical and mental stamina that you can draw on. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can use it to regain Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your Fighter level.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
When you reach certain Fighter levels, you gain more uses of this feature, as shown in the Second Wind column of the Fighter Features table.

classFeature.name: Action Surge
entries: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

classFeature.name: Tactical Mind
entries: You have a mind for tactics on and off the battlefield. When you fail an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, you can expend a use of your Second Wind to push yourself toward success. Rather than regaining Hit Points, you roll {@dice 1d10} and add the number rolled to the {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, potentially turning it into a success. If the check still fails, this use of Second Wind isn't expended.

classFeature.name: Martial Mastery
entries: You gain the mastery benefits for two {@filter weapons|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;!light;!medium;!heavy} of your choice as well as an {@filter armor|items|source=ishiir|type=|category=|homebrew mastery=!none;light;medium;heavy} type (see {@variantrule Armor Mastery|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Weapon Mastery|Ishiir} variant rules). You must be {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the chosen weapons and armor. If you possess the {@optfeature Unarmored Defense|Ishiir} feature, you may choose it in place of an armor type.
You can change your choices when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Martial Archetype
entries: You choose an archetype from the list available that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can do one of the following, as you shift the focus of your martial practice:

items: Replace a {@filter fighting style|optionalfeatures|feature type=FS:F|source=Ishiir} you know with another fighting style available to fighters.

If you know any {@filter maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B|source=Ishiir} from the {@class fighter|Ishiir|Battle Master|Battle Master|Ishiir|2-0} archetype, you can replace one maneuver you know with a different maneuver.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.
The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Tactical Shift
entries: You can move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} without provoking opportunity attacks when you use your Second Wind feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Martial Archetype feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Martial Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Indomitable
entries: When you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can add half your Fighter level (rounded down) to it, possibly turning it into a success.
You can use this feature twice between {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests} starting at 13th level and three times between {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests} starting at 17th level.

classFeature.name: Martial Supremacy
entries: When you use {@filter weapon masteries|optionalfeatures|feature type=WM}, you may choose from any mastery rather than only the ones available for your weapon.

classFeature.name: Martial Archetype feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Martial Archetype.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack (2)
entries: You can attack three times whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (two uses)
entries: You can use Indomitable twice between {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests}.

classFeature.name: Studied Attacks
entries: You masterfully study your opponents and learn from each attack you make. If you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against a creature and miss, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on your next {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against that creature before the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Martial Archetype feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Martial Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Action Surge (two uses)
entries: You can use Action Surge twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (three uses)
entries: You can use Indomitable three times between {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir|Long Rests}.

classFeature.name: Martial Archetype feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Martial Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack (3)
entries: You can attack four times whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer
entries: An Arcane Archer studies a unique elven method of archery that weaves magic into attacks to produce supernatural effects. Arcane Archers are some of the most elite warriors among the elves. They stand watch over the fringes of elven domains, keeping a keen eye out for trespassers and using magic-infused projectiles to defeat monsters and invaders before they can reach elven settlements. Over the centuries, the methods of these elf archers have been learned by members of other races who can also balance arcane aptitude with archery.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer Lore
entries: You learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature—typical for practitioners of this elven martial tradition. You choose to gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in either the {@skill Arcana} or the {@skill Nature} skill, and you choose to learn either the {@spell prestidigitation|Ishiir} or the {@spell druidcraft|Ishiir} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: You learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. When you gain this feature, you learn two Arcane Shot options of your choice (see "Arcane Shot Options" below).
Once per turn, when you make a ranged weapon attack as part of the Attack action, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that attack.
You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach certain levels in this class: 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

You have two uses of this feature, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind to regain a use of this feature (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: The Arcane Shot feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, your Arcane Shot save DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Magic Shot
entries: You gain the ability to infuse projectiles with magic. Whenever you make a ranged weapon attack with a nonmagical weapon, you can make it magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: You learn how to direct an errant projectile toward a new target. When you make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} with a magic projectile and miss, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to reroll the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Shots
entries: You learn the {@spell Booming Blade|Ishiir} and {@spell Green-Flame Blade|Ishiir} cantrips. You can use these cantrips with ranged and thrown weapons and their range is equal to the weapon's normal range.
Once per turn when you take the attack action, you can cast one of these cantrips in place of one of your ranged weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Quiver
entries: You can cast the {@spell Flame Arrows|Ishiir} and {@spell Lightning Arrow|Ishiir} spells once each without expending a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them. You cannot do so again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Ready Shot
entries: Your magical archery is available whenever battle starts. If you roll initiative and have no uses of Arcane Shot remaining, you regain one use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Arcane Shot Option
entries: You gain an additional Arcane Shot option of your choice when you reach 18th level. Each option also improves when you become an 18th-level fighter.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Arcane Quiver
entries: You can cast the {@spell Conjure Volley|Ishiir} spell once without expending a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. You cannot do so again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Master
entries: Those who emulate the archetypal Battle Master employ martial techniques passed down through generations. To a Battle Master, combat is an academic field, sometimes including subjects beyond battle such as weaponsmithing and calligraphy. Not every fighter absorbs the lessons of history, theory, and artistry that are reflected in the Battle Master archetype, but those who do are well-rounded fighters of great skill and knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You learn three maneuvers of your choice, which are listed under "Maneuvers" below. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack.
You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind to regain a superiority die (no action required).
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to resist the maneuver's effects. The {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Maneuver Options
entries: If you have access to maneuvers, the following maneuvers are added to the list of options available to you. Maneuvers are available to Battle Masters but also to characters who have a special feature like the {@optfeature Superior Technique|Ishiir} fighting style or the {@feat Martial Adept|Ishiir} feat.

subclassFeature.name: Maneuvers
entries: The maneuvers are presented in alphabetical order.

subclassFeature.name: Student of War
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Stealth}. You can choose to gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with an {@filter artisan's tools|items|source=Ishiir|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice in place of any of these skills.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: Your keen sense of observation allows you to spot weaknesses in your foe's defense. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check against a creature you can see within 60 feet. The DC is equal to 10 + half the creature's challenge rating (rounded down) or the creature's passive deception, whichever is higher. On a success, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the next {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against one of your maneuvers before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Maneuvers
entries: You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Maneuvers
entries: You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority (d10)
entries: Your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: When you roll initiative, you regain a number of superiority dice equal to half your maximum (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Additional Maneuvers
entries: You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority (d12)
entries: Your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Signature Maneuvers
entries: You have mastered certain techniques to the point that they have become second nature. Choose two maneuvers that you know. When you use one of these two maneuvers, you can roll a {@dice d8} and use it instead of expending a Combat Superiority Die.

subclassFeature.name: Brute
entries: Brutes are simple warriors who rely on mighty attacks and their own durability to overcome their enemies. Some brutes combine this physical might with tactical cunning. Others just hit things until those things stop hitting back.

subclassFeature.name: Brute Force
entries: You're able to strike with your weapons with especially brutal force. Whenever you hit with a weapon that you're {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with and deal damage, the weapon's damage increases by an amount based on your level in this class, as shown on the Brute Bonus Damage table. You can also add the same die to the roll if you make a Strength (Athletics) check.

subclassFeature.name: Brutish Durability
entries: Your toughness allows you to shrug off assaults that would devastate others.

Whenever you make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, roll {@dice 1d6} and add the die to your {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} total. If applying this bonus to a death {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Brutish Blows
entries: You can expend a use of your Second Wind when you hit with a weapon attack. If you do so, the target takes additional damage equal to {@damage 1d10} + your fighter level.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Critical
entries: When you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you gain a bonus to that weapon's damage roll equal to your level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Brutish Defiance
entries: If you drop to 0 Hit Points and don't die outright, you can change your Hit Points to a number equal to double your fighter level. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind (no action required) and add its healing to the total.
You can't use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Cavalier
entries: The archetypal Cavalier excels at mounted combat. Usually born among the nobility and raised at court, a Cavalier is equally at home leading a cavalry charge or exchanging repartee at a state dinner. Cavaliers also learn how to guard those in their charge from harm, often serving as the protectors of their superiors and of the weak. Compelled to right wrongs or earn prestige, many of these fighters leave their lives of comfort to embark on glorious adventure.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Your mastery as a rider becomes apparent. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you're not {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.
Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering Mark
entries: You can menace your foes, foiling their attacks and punishing them for harming others. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can mark the creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} or you die, or if someone else marks the creature.
While it is within 5 feet of you, a creature marked by you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on any {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} that doesn't target you.

In addition, if a creature marked by you deals damage to anyone other than you, you can make a special melee weapon attack against the marked creature as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your next turn. You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, and if it hits, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to half your fighter level.

Regardless of the number of creatures you mark, you can make this special attack a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind to regain a use of this feature (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Warding Maneuver
entries: You learn to fend off strikes directed at you, your mount, or other creatures nearby. If you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can roll {@dice 1d8} as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} if you're wielding a melee weapon or a shield. Roll the die, and add the number rolled to the target's AC against that attack. If the attack still hits, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against the attack's damage.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind to regain a use of this feature (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Hold the Line
entries: You become a master of locking down your enemies. Creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they move 5 feet or more while within your reach, and if you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, the target's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0 until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: You can run down your foes, whether you're mounted or not. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line right before attacking a creature and you hit it with the attack, that target takes additional damage equal to half your fighter level and must succeed on a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} (DC 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition Prone|Ishiir}. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Defender
entries: You respond to danger with extraordinary vigilance. In combat, you get a special {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} that you can take once on every creature's turn, except your turn. You can use this special {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} only to make an opportunity attack, and you can't use it on the same turn that you take your normal {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Champion
entries: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet.

You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in either the {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} skill. If you are already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the chosen skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} you make with it.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: You can choose a second option from the Fighting Style class feature.

subclassFeature.name: Champion's Reflexes
entries: You gain a second {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}. Additionally, you make Initiative {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Warrior
entries: {@i 10th-level fighter Champion feature (replaces Champion's Reflexes feature)}
The thrill of battle drives you toward victory. During combat, you can give yourself Heroic Inspiration whenever you start your turn without it.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Critical
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Recovery
entries: You can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to recover hitpoints equal to half your hitpoint maximum. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can spend three uses of your Indomitable feature to regain a use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Echo Knight
entries: A mysterious and feared frontline warrior of the Kryn Dynasty, the Echo Knight has mastered the art of using dunamis to summon the fading shades of unrealized timelines to aid them in battle. Surrounded by echoes of their own might, they charge into the fray as a cycling swarm of shadows and strikes.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Echo
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to magically manifest an echo of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you. This echo is a magical, translucent, gray image of you that lasts until it is destroyed, until you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, until you manifest another echo, or until you're {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.

Your echo's AC is equal to yours, has 1 hit point, and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to all conditions. If it has to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it uses your {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} bonus for the roll. It is the same size as you, and it occupies its space. On your turn, you can mentally command the echo to move up to 30 feet in any direction (no action required). If your echo is ever more than 30 feet from you at the end of your turn, it is destroyed.
You can use the echo in the following ways:

items: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can teleport, magically swapping places with your echo at a cost of 15 feet of your movement, regardless of the distance between the two of you.
When you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn, any attack you make with that action can originate from your space or the echo's space. You make this choice for each attack.

When a creature that you can see within 5 feet of your echo moves at least 5 feet away from it, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to make an opportunity attack against that creature as if you were in the echo's space.

subclassFeature.name: Unleash Incarnation
entries: You can heighten your echo's fury. Whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can make one additional melee attack from the echo's position.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Echo Avatar
entries: You can temporarily transfer your consciousness to your echo. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can see through your echo's eyes and hear through its ears. You can sustain this effect for up to 10 minutes, and you can end it at any time (requires no action). While your echo is being used in this way, it can be up to 1,000 feet away from you without being destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Martyr
entries: You can make your echo throw itself in front of an attack directed at another creature that you can see. Before the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} is made, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to teleport the echo to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the targeted creature. The {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} that triggered the {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} is instead made against your echo.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or you spend a use of your Second Wind (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Reclaim Potential
entries: You've learned to absorb the fleeting magic of your echo. When an echo of yours is destroyed by taking damage, you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Constitution modifier.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Legion of One
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to create two echoes with your Manifest Echo feature, and these echoes can coexist. If you try to create a third echo, the previous two echoes are destroyed. Anything you can do from one echo's position can be done from the other's instead.
In addition, when you roll initiative and have no uses of your Unleash Incarnation feature left, you regain one use of that feature.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Knight
entries: The archetypal Eldritch Knight combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with a careful study of magic. Eldritch Knights use magical techniques similar to those practiced by wizards. These knights learn a comparatively small number of spells, committing them to memory instead of keeping them in a spellbook.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Eldritch Knights combine the martial mastery common to all Fighters with a careful study of magic. Their spells both complement and extend their combat skills, providing additional protection to shore up their armor and also allowing them to engage many foes at once with explosive magic.

entries.name: Cantrips.
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}. Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list.
When you reach Fighter level 10, you learn another Wizard cantrip of your choice, as shown in this subclass' progression table.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 spells from the Wizard spell list.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Fighter levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Wizard spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Fighter, your list of prepared spells can include five Wizard spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Wizard spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Wizard spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus.
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB} as a Spellcasting Focus for your Wizard spells.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Bond
entries: You learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between yourself and one weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}. The weapon must be within your reach throughout the ritual, at the conclusion of which you touch the weapon and forge the bond.

Once you have bonded a weapon to yourself, you can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon that weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

You can have up to two bonded weapons, but can summon only one at a time with your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}. If you attempt to bond with a third weapon, you must break the bond with one of the other two.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: Once per turn when you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can cast a cantrip in place of one of your weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: You learn how to make your weapon strikes undercut a creature's {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to your spells. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the next {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Charge
entries: You gain the ability to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see when you use your Action Surge. You can teleport before or after the additional action.

subclassFeature.name: Improved War Magic
entries: Once per turn when you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action, you can cast a spell in place of two of your melee weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Hunter
entries: As an archetypal Monster Hunter, you are an expert at defeating supernatural threats. Typically mentored by an older, experienced Monster Hunter, you learn to overcome a variety of unnatural defenses and attacks, including those of undead, lycanthropes, and other creatures of horror.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Perception}. You can choose to gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item thieves' tools|phb} in place of one skill choice.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: You gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind to regain a superiority die (no action required).

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you miss with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can expend one Superiority Die, roll that die, and add it to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, potentially causing the attack to hit.

When you damage a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the damage roll. You can use this ability after rolling damage. If the attack causes the target to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on that save.
When you fail an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll, possibly turning the failure into a success.

When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check to detect a hidden creature or object, or a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check to determine if someone is lying to you, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this feature after seeing the total but before learning if you succeeded or failed.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Mysticism
entries: Your study of the supernatural gives you a limited ability to use magic. You can cast {@spell detect magic|Ishiir} as a ritual. You can cast {@spell protection from evil and good|Ishiir} on yourself as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} and without expending a Spell Slot, but you cannot cast it again with this feature until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

In addition, you gain the ability to speak three of the following languages of your choice: {@language Abyssal}, {@language Celestial}, {@language Deep Speech}, {@language Draconic}, {@language Giant}, {@language Primordial}, {@language Sylvan}, or Umbral.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer
entries: You can choose three creature types, except humanoids. Whenever you expend superiority dice to add to a damage roll, you can expend up to two dice instead of just one, adding both to the roll. Both dice are expended as normal. If the target of your attack has one of your chosen creature types, you deal maximum damage with all combat superiority dice you expended, instead of rolling them.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: Your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. They turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: When you roll initiative, you regain a number of superiority dice equal to half your maximum (rounded down)

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: Your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Aegis
entries: When you cast {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|Ishiir} through your Hunter's Mysticism Feature, it does not require {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} and lasts for 7 days.

subclassFeature.name: Psi Warrior
entries: Awake to the psionic power within, a Psi Warrior is a fighter who augments their physical might with psi-infused weapon strikes, telekinetic lashes, and barriers of mental force. Many githyanki train to become such warriors, as do some of the most disciplined high elves. In the world of Eberron, many young kalashtar dream of becoming Psi Warriors.

As a Psi Warrior, you might have honed your psionic abilities through solo discipline, unlocked it under the tutelage of a master, or refined it at an academy dedicated to wielding the mind's power as both weapon and shield.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. It is represented by your Psionic Energy Dice, which fuel powers you have from this subclass. The Psi Warrior Energy Dice table shows the die size and number of these dice you have when you reach certain Fighter levels.

Any features in this subclass that use a Psionic Energy Die use only the dice from this subclass. Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy Die, as specified in a power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use a die when all your Psionic Energy Dice are expended.
You regain one of your expended Psionic Energy Dice when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, and you regain all of them when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

items.name: Protective Field.
items.entry: When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll the die, and reduce the damage taken by the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum reduction of 1), as you create a momentary shield of telekinetic force.

items.name: Psionic Strike.
items.entry: You can propel your weapons with psionic force. Once on each of your turns, immediately after you hit a target within 30 feet of yourself with an attack and deal damage to it with a weapon, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die, rolling it and dealing Force damage to the target equal to the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier.

items.name: Telekinetic Movement.
entries: You can move an object or a creature with your mind. As a {@action Magic|Ishiir} action, choose one target you can see within 30 feet of yourself; the target must be a loose object that is Large or smaller or one willing creature other than you. You transport the target up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Alternatively, if the target is a Tiny object, you can transport it to or from your hand.

Once you take this action, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Adept
entries: You have mastered new ways to use your telekinetic abilities, detailed below.

subclassFeature.name: Psi-Powered Leap
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can propel your body with your mind. You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} equal to twice your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} until the end of the current turn. Once you take this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to take it again.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Thrust
entries: When you deal damage to a target with your Psionic Strike, you can force the target to make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a DC equal to 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Intelligence modifier. If the save fails, you can knock the target {@condition Prone|Ishiir} or move it up to 10 feet in any direction horizontally.

subclassFeature.name: Guarded Mind
entries: The psionic energy flowing through you has bolstered your mind. You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to psychic damage. Moreover, if you start your turn {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} or {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}, you can expend a Psionic Energy die and end every effect on yourself subjecting you to those conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark of Force
entries: You can shield yourself and others with telekinetic force. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can choose creatures, which can include you, that you can see within 30 feet of you, up to a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one creature). Each of the chosen creatures is protected by half cover for 1 minute or until you're {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.
Once you take this {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you expend a Psionic Energy die to take it again.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Master
entries: You always have the {@spell Telekinesis|Ishiir} spell prepared. With this feature, you can cast it without a spell slot or components, and your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence. On each of your turns while you maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on it, including the turn when you cast it, you can make one attack with a weapon as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Banneret
entries: A Banneret inspires greatness in others by committing brave deeds in battle. The mere presence of a knight in a hamlet is enough to cause some enemies to seek easier prey. A lone knight is a skilled warrior, but a knight leading a band of allies can transform even the most poorly equipped militia into a ferocious war band.
A knight prefers to lead through deeds, not words. As a knight spearheads an attack, the knight's actions can awaken reserves of courage and conviction in allies that they never suspected they had.

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Cry
entries: You learn how to inspire your allies to fight on past their injuries.

When you use your Second Wind feature, you can choose up to three creatures within 60 feet of you that are allied with you. Each one regains hit points equal to your fighter level plus twice your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, provided that the creature can see or hear you.
If a creature is healed for more hit points than they are missing, they regain the difference as temporary hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Surge
entries: When you use your Action Surge feature, you can choose one creature within 60 feet of you that is allied with you. That creature can make one melee or ranged weapon attack with its {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, provided that it can see or hear you.
Starting at 18th level, you can choose two allies within 60 feet of you, rather than one.

subclassFeature.name: Royal Envoy
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Persuasion} skill. If you are already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in it, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Performance}.

Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make that uses {@skill Persuasion}. You receive this benefit regardless of the skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you gain from this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark
entries: When an ally within 60 feet of you fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can expend a use of your Indomitable class feature as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to grant its benefit to that ally.

subclassFeature.name: Vanguard
entries: The number of uses of your Second Wind feature increases by two, and the number of uses for your Indomitable feature increases by one.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Surge
entries: You can choose two allies within 60 feet of you, rather than one.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Knight
entries: Rune Knights enhance their martial prowess using the supernatural power of runes, an ancient practice that originated with giants. Rune cutters can be found among any family of giants, and you likely learned your methods first or second hand from such a mystical artisan. Whether you found the giant's work carved into a hill or cave, learned of the runes from a sage, or met the giant in person, you studied the giant's craft and learned how to apply magic runes to empower your equipment.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item armorsmith's tools|Ishiir} or {@item weaponsmith's tools|Ishiir}, and you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Giant}.

subclassFeature.name: Giant's Might
entries: You have learned how to imbue yourself with the might of giants. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you magically gain the following benefits, which last for 1 minute:

items: If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If you lack the room to become Large, your size doesn't change.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
Once on each of your turns, one of your attacks with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|Ishiir} can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to a target on a hit.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Carver
entries: You can use magic runes to enhance your gear. You learn two runes of your choice, from among the runes described below, and each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one rune you know with a different one from this feature. When you reach certain levels in this class, you learn additional runes, as shown in the Runes Known table.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can touch a number of objects equal to the number of runes you know, and you inscribe a different rune onto each of the objects. To be eligible, an object must be a weapon, a suit of armor, a shield, a piece of jewelry, or something else you can wear or hold in a hand. Your rune remains on an object until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, and an object can bear only one of your runes at a time.

The following runes are available to you when you learn a rune. If a rune has a level requirement, you must be at least that level in this class to learn the rune. If a rune requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, your Rune Magic save DC equals 8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Rune Known
entries: You learn an additional Rune.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Shield
entries: You learn to invoke your rune magic to protect your allies. When another creature you can see within 60 feet of you is hit by an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to force the attacker to reroll the {@dice d20} and use the new roll.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Additionally, you can spend one use of your Second Wind to regain one use.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Rune Known
entries: You learn an additional Rune.

subclassFeature.name: Great Stature
entries: The magic of your runes permanently alters you. When you gain this feature, roll {@dice 3d4}. You grow a number of inches in height equal to the roll.
Moreover, the extra damage you deal with your Giant's Might feature increases to {@dice 1d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Rune Known
entries: You learn an additional Rune.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Runes
entries: You can invoke each rune you know from your Rune Carver feature twice, rather than once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Juggernaut
entries: You learn how to amplify your rune-powered transformation. As a result, the extra damage you deal with the Giant's Might feature increases to {@dice 1d10}. Moreover, when you use that feature, your size can increase to Huge, and while you are that size, your reach increases by 5 feet.
Additionally, you now regain the use of your Giant's Might feature on a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Samurai
entries: The Samurai is a fighter who draws on an implacable fighting spirit to overcome enemies. A Samurai's resolve is nearly unbreakable, and the enemies in a Samurai's path have two choices: yield or die fighting.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: Your intensity in battle can shield you and help you strike true. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn, you can give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on weapon {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} until the end of the current turn. When you do so, you also gain temporary hit points equal to your fighter level + Wisdom modifier.
You can use this feature three times. You regain one use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} and all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Elegant Courtier
entries: Your discipline and attention to detail allow you to excel in social situations. Whenever you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Your self-control also causes you to gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}. If you already have this {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}, you instead gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in Intelligence or Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Tireless Spirit
entries: You regain all uses of Fighting Spirit when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strike
entries: You learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn and have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against one of the targets, you can forgo the {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} for that roll to make an additional weapon attack against that target, as part of the same action. You can do so no more than once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Strength before Death
entries: Your fighting spirit can delay the grasp of death. If you take damage that reduces you to 0 hit points and doesn't kill you outright, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to delay falling {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir}, and you can immediately take an extra turn, interrupting the current turn. While you have 0 hit points during that extra turn, taking damage causes death {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} failures as normal, and three death {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} failures can still kill you. When the extra turn ends, you fall {@condition Unconscious|Ishiir} if you still have 0 hit points.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Scout
entries: The archetypal Scout excels at finding safe passage through dangerous regions. Scouts usually favor light armor and ranged weapons, but they are comfortable using heavier gear when faced with intense fighting.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in three of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}. You can choose to gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item thieves' tools|phb} in place of one skill choice.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: You gain a set of abilities that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also spend a use of your Second Wind to regain a superiority die (no action required). You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

entries.name: Using Superiority Dice
entries: You can expend superiority dice to gain a number of different benefits:

items: When you make a check that allows you to apply your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}, you can expend one superiority die to bolster the check. Add the number rolled on the superiority die to your check. You apply this bonus after making the check but before learning if it was successful.
When you miss with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can expend one Superiority Die, roll that die, and add it to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, potentially causing the attack to hit.

If you are hit by an attack while wearing light or medium armor, you can expend one superiority die as a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, adding the number rolled to your AC. If the attack still hits, you take half damage from it.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Explorer
entries: You are a master of navigating the natural world, and you react with swift and decisive action when attacked. This grants you the following benefits:

items: You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on initiative rolls.
On your first turn during combat, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against creatures that have not yet acted.

entries: In addition, you are skilled at navigating the wilderness. You gain the following benefits when traveling for an hour or more:

items: Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel.
Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

subclassFeature.name: Expertise
entries: Choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with {@item thieves' tools|phb}. Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus is doubled for any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: Your superiority dice turn into {@dice d10}s. At 18th level, they turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: When you roll initiative, you regain a number of superiority dice equal to half your maximum (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Additional Superiority Die
entries: You gain another superiority die at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: Your superiority dice turn into {@dice d12}s.

subclassFeature.name: Scout's Swiftness
entries: You can roll a Combat Superiority Die without expending it and add it to your initiative.

Additionally, when initiative is rolled but before the first round of combat, you can expend a Combat Superiority Die to move up to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} and make a single weapon attack. If it hits, you add your Combat Superiority Die to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The Sharpshooter is a master of ranged combat. An excellent sniper and eagle-eyed scout, this fighter is a perilous foe who can defeat an entire war band so long as they are kept at range.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Aim
entries: Your aim becomes deadly. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on your turn, you can take careful aim at a creature you can see that is within range of a ranged weapon you're wielding. Until the end of this turn, your ranged attacks with that weapon gain two benefits against the target:

items: The attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.
On each hit, the weapon deals additional damage to the target equal to 2 + half your fighter level.

entries: You can use this feature three times. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. Additionally, you can spend one use of your Second Wind to regain one use.

subclassFeature.name: Careful Eyes
entries: You excel at picking out hidden enemies and other threats. You can take the {@action Search|Ishiir} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Perception}, {@skill Investigation}, or {@skill Survival} skill (choose one).

subclassFeature.name: Close-Quarters Shooting
entries: You learn to handle yourself in close combat. Making a ranged {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} while within 5 feet of an enemy doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on your roll.
In addition, if you hit a creature within 5 feet of you with a ranged attack on your turn, that creature can't take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} until the end of this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strike
entries: You learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on a weapon attack against a target on your turn, you can forgo that {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} to immediately make an additional weapon attack against the same target as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Snap Shot
entries: You are ever ready to spring into action. If you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your first turn of a combat, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as part of that action.
